name: Norepinephrine Bitartrate
indications: Norepinephrine Bitartrate Injection is indicated to raise blood pressure in adult patients with severe, acute hypotension.
contraindications: • Initial dose of 0.25 mL to 0.375 mL (from 8 mcg to 12 mcg of base) per minute, adjust the rate of flow to establish and maintain a low to normal blood pressure (usually 80 mm Hg to 100 mm Hg systolic) sufficient to maintain the circulation of vital organs. (2.2 ) • The average maintenance dose ranges from 0.0625 mL to 0.125 mL per minute (from 2 mcg to 4 mcg of base). ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions:
Norepinephrine Bitartrate Injection, USP, is a sterile, colorless to pale yellow solution for injection intended for intravenous use. It contains the equivalent of 1 mg of norepinephrine base per 1 mL (4 mg/4 mL). It is available as 4 mg/4 mL in single-dose amber glass vials.

                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F); excursions permitted to 15° to 30°C (59° to 86°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature.]
                  Store in original carton until time of administration to protect from light. Discard unused portion.
